Use technology: Utilize technology like smartwatches or sensors that can detect changes in pressure or temperature to alert you to potential hazards.
Develop a routine: Establish a routine for checking your body for injuries or abnormalities, such as inspecting your skin for cuts or scrapes, and checking your joints for swelling.
Seek professional help: Consult with a medical professional to learn about alternative methods for sensing and protecting yourself from injury.
Train your senses: Train your senses to become more sensitive to certain stimuli, such as touch or temperature, to compensate for the loss of physical sensation.
Learn to recognize pain: Develop an understanding of what pain feels like and how it is typically experienced, so you can recognize it when it occurs.
